column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4729_e070c125db26001cbe42278a1d6f6374dc469135/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te
I actually find that the flow of the paragraph was much cleaner in the previous form.\n
@TheBlueMatt That was definitely not a response I was looking for, lol. Closing, and trying again.\n

@bitcoinsSG Sorry for that! My gut feeling is that you'll get more positive response to a documentation commit if you document things that are not documented right now or need to be explained more thoroughly.

These are a few ancient phrases that people have gotten so used to over time, that any change looks 'weird'.
@laanwj no problem. I appreciate the insight and explanation; they make a lot of sense. I'll keep your suggestions in mind for the next pull request. Thanks again.\n
_the_ was left out on purpose here. There are multiple full node implementations.\n
I changed it back to "the network" \n
